CatDescriptText: Mr. John B. Simpson, 128 E. 15th Avenue, Homestead, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 26, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "In your opinion, what constitutes the 'Leadership' in Negro community in Pittsburgh? What do you think of that which exists?" Answer reads: "I think that Negro leadership has made it better for every American spirited Negro in the Pittsburgh area.  Negro leadership is good.  And example is the type of Negro leadership in the unions, in society, and in other areas by which the ability to lead is shown."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of John B. Simpson wearing diagonally striped necktie and jacket, standing in front of Rosenbaum Company, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
